fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60304].
  {panel}

In our workflow we have a transition called 'Reject', that has a transition-screen named 'only comments'. This screen has no fields, so in JIRA the result is a transition with a screen that only holds the comment field. The 'Reject' transition has a validator that requires a comment filled in.

When a bulk transition of 'Reject' is used, JIRA does not see that a screen is attached (I guess it can't see the difference between an empty screen and no screen at all).

Result is that we can not give any comments and therefor the validation failed. So no bulk transitions is possible for this transition:

 !image-2016-03-23-11-48-12-447.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Support adding a comment during bulk transitions when no fields are on the transition screen

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The Wiki Markup in JIRA has two "Preformatted" options. One is under the "Style" dropdown and is only available for a single line text:

!style.png|thumbnail!

While the other is under the "+" dropdown and can be used for a long text with multiple lines:

!more.png|thumbnail!

This can cause some confusion for users since they share the same name and the difference between them is not clear.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the name of one of them or specify that all styles under "Style" are available only for single-line texts.
fields.summary: Change the preformatted option in Wiki Markup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60293].
  {panel}

*Current behaviour*
*Trigger*: Addition of a 'Group custom field value > your-group-picker-custom-field' to Browse Projects permission in a permission scheme.
*Causes*: All project names of projects using that permission scheme to become viewable by all users.
*Already Verified by Atlassian*: [JST-189143|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/agent/JST/issue/JST-189143]

*Expected behaviour*
The trigger above would make each project name using that permission scheme to be viewable just by members of groups which names are selectable values in the appropriate context(s) for that project(s).

*Research on old issues*
*Similar issue*: JRA-10940 (Closed because of a long inactivity period, but not resolved)
*Caused by?*: JRA-14670
*Related to?*: JRA-26659, JRA-23732, JRA-30209, JRA-30783, JRA-43008, JRA-37242
*Bugs that may be fixed*: JRA-28278, JRA-28523, JRA-19577
*Perceived as a bug*: JRA-30784

*Documentation*
The current behaviour should be documented.
Besides other documentation pages, it would be good to add the following phrase under the section [Managing Issues via Group Ownership|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/how-do-i-assign-issues-to-multiple-users-207489749.html#HowdoIassignissuestomultipleusers-ManagingIssuesviaGroupOwnership] 
_Note that granting with Browse Projects permission to a 'Group custom field value' will make all project names using that permission scheme to be viewable by all users._
fields.summary: Improve implementation of 'Group custom field value' on permission schemes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
According to [Attaching files and screenshots to issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver071/attaching-files-and-screenshots-to-issues-802172665.html], users should be able to attach a screenshot into the issue through the right click menu, but it is not possible in Firefox and IE.

h3. Environment
* IE 11
* Firefox 45

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a screenshot and copy it to the clipboard
# Open an issue in Internet Explorer or Firefox
# Paste the screenshot into the issue field by right clicking on it and select "Paste".

h3. Expected Results
The user is able to click on "Paste" and see the Attach Screenshot Dialog. 

h3. Actual Results
The "Paste" option is grayed out on the right-click menu and the user is unable to click on it.

h3. Workaround

It is still possible to screenshot into the issue by pressing the keyboard combination for pasting (Control + V / Cmd + V) 
 
h3. Notes
It is possible to paste the screenshot through the right-click menu in Google Chrome.
fields.summary: Unable to attach screenshots in IE and Firefox through the right-click menu.

fields.description:

fields.description:
Adding any wiki markup to a line in a list (ordered or unordered) which has a sub-level will add an unwanted space before the sublevels.

That is a hard description of working through, but this is obvious with examples:
h4. No markup, no problem
* level 1 bullet
** level 2 bullet is fine
*** level 3 bullet is fine
* level 1 again, no problem
h4. markup adds unwanted space
* level 1 with wiki markup (e.g. a link to [http://www.google.com])
** now level 2 has space above it!
*** level three is fine as long as level two does not use wiki markup
* level 1 again

Also, there is an inconsistency between the way content is displayed when I "Preview" it and when I "Submit" the content. 

This only seems to appear when there exists wiki markup on the line, and the next line is a sublevel of the list.
fields.summary: wiki markup adds unwanted space in bulleted/numbered lists

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using a *Complete Date/Time Format* that ends up being bigger than the default value, full dates on attachment thumbnails end up being cut in half, which keeps users from seeing the exact date/time of when an attachment was uploaded.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Disable relative dates following [these instructions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/disable-relative-dates-in-jira-applications-414187622.html]
# Navigate to the *Look and feel* page.
# Change the *Complete Date/Time Format* to include the timezone as well by adding the letter *z* to the string.
#* {{dd/MMM/yy h:mm a z}}
# Attach a file to an issue.

h3. Expected Results

The attached file will display all its information (file name, date and size) when viewed in thumbnail format.

h3. Actual Results

When viewing the attachment in thumbnail view, the date of when the file was uploaded will not be displayed, only the top of the text will show up on the attachment.

h3.Workaround
At this time, the only known workaround is to revert the *Compete Date/Time Format* to the original settings.
fields.summary: Date of attached files is not visible for thumbnails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60269].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open a JIRA issue
2. Resolve that issue by committing a code change to the git repository that references the JIRA issue; e.g. PROJECT-0001 fixed
3. Observe the issue has the commit associated with it

PROBLEM: if this is the wrong ticket, you cannot change it unless you force push a change to the commit comment, which is highly discouraged in a multi-develop environment.

SOLUTION: one idea is, when the commit message is scanned and a jira issue is found, create a link between the issue and the commit. Allow that link to be edited or removed. Also, allow links to be manually created. In the example above, one could edit the link:

1234567 PROJECT-0001

to be

1234567 PROJECT-0002

And a commit for which the developer forgot to refer to the lira ticket could be added:

abcdef12 PROJECT-0003
fields.summary: Cannot change commit

h3. Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Issues > Import Issues from CSV
# Choose CSV file and configure settings 
# Map Original estimate, Remaining Estimate, Time spent and Summary Fields
# Validate and Import

h3. Expected Results

The issue is imported and time tracking details is displayed on the right of an issue page.
 !time tracking available.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

The issue is imported but time tracking details is not displayed on the right of an issue page.
!no time tracking after import.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Import Issue via external system import as mentioned in [Running the CSV file import wizard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/importing-data-from-csv-185729516.html#ImportingDatafromCSV-RunningtheCSVfileimportwizard] page.

h3. Additional Note

Unable to reproduce this issue in latest version of JIRA due to [JRA-60260|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60260] bug

Steps
1. Start creating a jira ticket
2. Enter the code macro
3. Try putting curlybrace-code-curlybrace inside the code block (i.e. 7B 63 6F 64 65 7D):

What's wrong:
The formatting breaks:
 !code_block.png|thumbnail! 
{code:JavaScript}
var i = {"key":"{code}"}
{code}
Expected result:
This page: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/244810/how-can-i-escape-curly-braces-within-code-tags says that you should use the escape \{code\} sequence.

video:
http://screencast.com/t/Sk1uVhII

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60244].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, with the daily maintenance in Cloud, users are prompted with a notification banner on the top right in their instance to re-index due to changes in plugins. This notification keeps appearing repeatedly on any page even when it has been dismissed by users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Either:
* Run indexing in the background after maintenance is completed; OR
* Bypass indexing for changes that are not critical for the plugins, thus, the notification shouldn't pop up at all; OR
* Allow the option for dismissing the notification for a certain period of time (E.g: 1 week)
 
h3. Workaround 
Dismissing the notification manually.
fields.summary: Daily maintenance in Cloud causing persistent notification for re-indexing

h3. Summary
In some cases, a customer might not be able to search and select a specific column to add to the issue navigator screen. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA 
* More than 25 custom fields, which have a common word
** One of the custom fields is just the common word
** The common word appears in the search results list more than 25 items down 
** For example the set of custom fields: {code}["a unit", "aa unit", "b unit", "bb unit", "c unit", ... , "zz unit", "unit"]{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create above set of custom fields
# Open the issue navigator and click on the 'Columns' drop down. 
# Type unit

h3. Expected Results
As the custom field *unit* is an exact match to the term being searched, it should be displayed first on the list. 

h3. Actual Results
Observe that the search results do not display unit and there is no way to narrow them further to get this result.
 !Screen Shot 2016-03-18 at 4.32.40 pm.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2016-03-18 at 4.30.50 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
* Rename custom fields
fields.summary: Improve behaviour of Issue Navigator 'Add Columns' search

Hello,

As more code branches being created, it would be helpful to be able to create hierarchical versions, e.g:

Trunk -> V1.0.0.B01
Trunk -> V1.0.0.B02

h3. Problem Definition
If a user wants to search for issues by clicking *Issues* > *Search for issues*, they are taken to an empty search that retrieves all issues that the user is able to view.
This places unnecessary load on the system, and in general doesn't provide anything useful to the user since they will normally go on to create a suitable search at this point.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the configuration setting to do not list all issues when clicking 'Search for issues' or JQL with Empty Search

h3. Current Results:
The entire set of issues in the JIRA instance is returned as the search result. 

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: As an Administrator I want to change default behaviour for Empty Search

fields.description:
I want to style the inline segment metric{id="a", instance="b"} as monospace in an issue, but doing that doesn't seem to be achievable simply by surrounding it with double-braces: {{metric{id="a", instance="b"}}}, as is visible in this description.

Escaping the braces in the segment isn't enough either: {{metric\{id="a", instance="b"\}}} since the last brace isn't included in the monospace segment. Escaping the braces and adding some junk before the closing double-braces allows the closing single-brace to be formatted, but the junk is also included: {{metric\{id="a", instance="b"\}junk}}.
fields.summary: Unable to style a section of comment as monospace

h3. Summary

Custom icons for Priority not shown in Issue Navigator or Dashboard if the icon name / path contains spaces.

 !Bug.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

JIRA 7.1.0, 7.1.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Name an image with space. For example {{Test 1.png}}
# Copy the image to {{<JIRA-INSTALL-DIRECTORY>/atlassian-jira/images/icons/priority}}
# Open Priority page in JIRA. (Settings -> Issues -> Priority)
# Configure the new icon with any of the Priority and apply the change.
# Create an issue with the priority which is using the custom icon.
# Open Issue Navigator and enable priority column.
# We will see that the custom icon is not shown but other issues with the in build icons will show properly.

h3. Expected Results

The priority icon is displayed properly in Issue Navigator / Dashboard

h3. Actual Results

The priority icon is not displayed in Issue Navigator / Dashboard

h3.Workaround

Rename the icon file in a way that there is no space in between the characters. For example, rename {{Test 1.png}} to {{Test1.png}}
fields.summary: Custom icons for Priority not shown in Issue Navigator

h3. Problem Definition

Sometimes JIRA plugin will be disabled after exceeded 60 seconds default timeout. The workaround would be increasing the plugin timeout to 300 seconds according to this KB: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+applications+System+Plugin+Timeout+While+Waiting+for+Add-ons+to+Enable

h3. Suggested Solution

Increase plugin default timeout to 300 seconds so next time user no need to re-add the option in all Atlassian products.

h3. Summary
It's not possible to change an issue type from a custom sub-task type to the default sub-task type using the 'More' > 'Move' > 'Change issue type' wizard.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new sub-task issue type
# Create a standard issue
# From this recent created standard issue create a sub-task ('More' > 'Create sub-task') and select the custom sub-task type you created on step 1
# Open this newly created sub-task issue and try to change its issue type ('More' > 'Move' > 'Change issue type') and select the default Sub-task type and click 'Next'

h3. Expected Results
You're able to change the issue type
h3. Actual Results
An error message appears on the screen: {color:red}*The issue type selected is invalid.*{color}


h3.Workaround
If you have the Issue Type field in the View Issue and Edit Issue screens you can edit the issue type from the view issue screen.

+Request Summary+
A JIRA instance will have a few administrator. Some of these administrator must be restricted from creating new user.

+Request Description+
Some of JIRA user required administrator privilege because they need to perform some higher level configuration like schemes configuration. Once we granted an admin right to a user these users are able to create new users which will mess up the JIRA instance if they start to create users as they like. We need a feature to customize the admin privilege for certain users to achieve a balance environment in JIRA instance.

+Suggestion+
# Customize admin privilege whereby we can restrict an admin from creating new user.

h3. Summary
When previewing PDFs attached to issues on JIRA 7.1 using Internet Explorer 11, most times the file is not previewed as expected.

h3. Environment
* Running Modern.IE with VirtualBox and using Internet Explorer 11.0.9600 32 Bits
* JIRA Core 7.1.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Internet Explorer 11, open an issue that have a PDF attached;
# Click on the attached PDF's thumbnail to preview it.

h3. Expected Results
The PDF file is previewed on the screen.

h3. Actual Results
Most times, the preview screen hangs on the loading wheel. By closing the preview and opening again a few times, the preview may eventually appear.
I have recorded a video showing this behavior and attached it to this issue.
[^PDF Preview.mov]
 
h3.Workaround
* Download the attached file to the computer to visualize it;
* Use a different browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari).
fields.summary: PDF preview not working properly on IE11

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60203].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Cannot remove user from project roles in project administration > Users and Roles

h3. Environment
JIRA v7.1.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new user with username that starts with '0'. Example '06744'
# Add user to any project role
# Click on the trash icon to remove user from project roles in project administration > Users and Roles

h3. Expected Results
User should be removed from the Project Role

h3. Actual Results
User is not removed from the Project Role

 
h3. Notes
* This is caused by the request to delete the user automatically dropping the '0' from the username. The Har file shows that the user: 6477 is deleted from the project role, instead of the expected '06477' username. 
* This problem is reproducible with groupname which starts with "0" as well.
* Does not happen on JIRA 6.x

h3.Workaround
* Remove the user from project roles in JIRA administration > User Management instead
* Avoiding the use of numeric usernames, or using the REST API to manually remove the user from the project role: 
{noformat}
curl '<BASE-URL>/rest/api/2/project/XXXX/role/10002?user=06744' -X DELETE -u....
{noformat}
fields.summary: Unable to remove user from Project Roles in project administration when the username starts with 0

h3. Summary:
The top part of the issue navigator page like the filter name and JQL search options is out of view and there will be blank space on the bottom when clicking the Comment button after doing certain steps.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Access this [link|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28564?jql=project%20%3D%20CONF%20AND%20fixVersion%20in%20%285.5.8%2C%205.5%2C%205.5.1%2C%205.5.2%2C%205.5.3%2C%205.5.4%2C%205.5.6%2C%205.5.7%29%20ORDER%20BY%20votes%20DESC%2C%20priority%20DESC%2C%20key%20DESC]
# Click on "Return to Search" on the top left.
# Back to the Issue Navigator view and change to "Detail View"
# Click on "Comment"

h3. Actual result:
Note the comment box opens, while the Issue Navigator Elements or the whole top part of the page is out of the view and there's a white border section below the page: The header section of the page with the filter options and the Atlassian/JIRA header is scrolled out of view:
 !image-2016-03-15-11-24-50-127.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected result:
Header is visible, Add comment button is in view, No missing/scrolled out filter elements on top.

h3. Notes:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60200].
  {panel}

IMAP is fragile.  The nature of the protocol is that a partial memento of the email is made available to Mail Handlers, and that calls to the underlying message object to obtain body content and attachments result in direct chatter back to the mailserver.  If the mailserver decides for some reason to kill the connection the client Mail Handler gets a Folder Closed Exception, which is covered in quite a few places:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29228

Currently, what can happen is that in this situation, the mail handler cannot process the mail, because the server closed the connection.  The JIRA API for Mail Handlers currently provides a TRUE (we processed it, so mark read or delete) / FALSE (we didn't process it, leave it unread).  Unfortunately what seems to happen is that the 'broken' nature of this message is somehow cached via the IMAP connection, and is re-presented to mail handlers again, which breaks, again.

It may be possible to 'poke' the Mail Service back into life by revalidating its mail connection, but this may have unforeseen implications for other mail handers that could be in progress, hence this issue.

Potentially mail handlers could return 'true' to indicate that JIRA should mark the message read and delete, it's possible that would stop the same message being re-presented to the mail handler repeatedly, but could result in message loss without processing, so isnt a good option.

It would be better if a Mail Handler API enabled support for a specific Exception to indicate the nature of the problem (generally ALL related to IMAP), to drive the connection refresh, or return some kind of enumeration, which allows for more expressive hinting about what JIRA should do in the event of a failure to process a message that occurs at a protocol level.
fields.summary: IMAP and handling of FolderClosedExceptions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem
User who can't access to the issue due to Issue Security level, can somehow add a comment to the issue via email with subject contains an issue key. This is consider as a security breach and it could cause comment spam.

h3. Steps to reproduce
1) Create a test user.
2) For Issue Security level, set to a level which the test user is not permitted to access to.
3) Assign the issue security level from step 2 to an existing issue.
4) Sign in as the test user. This test user have the browse project and create issue permission in the project.
5) Access to the issue directly using the URL, user should be unable to view the issue due to issue security.
6) Send an email to the project mail handler with the subject contains the issue key.
7) Note that the email will be added as a comment to the issue, but user is still unable to view the issue.

h3. Suggestion
There should be a validation layer when creating issue or add comment from email. It should respect the issue security setting.
fields.summary: Users can add comment via email regardless of the issue's security level

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using a CSV import to update a moved issue, it incorrectly moves the issue back to the previous project and viewing the issue is no longer possible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Import or create an issue, for example MWK-1.
# Move issue to another project, in this example it becomes TECH-2. This can also involve changing things such as version and component, which are project-specific.
# CSV import the issue using the old key MWK-1.

h3. Expected Results

The TECH-2 issue is updated, using the data from MWK-1 (it will correctly find the issue using the {{moved_issue_key}} table).

	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:483) [?:1.8.0_20]
{noformat}

See [^full_stack_trace] for more info.

h3. Notes

Looking into the database we can see the problem is the project key is changed back to what it was. Prior to the import:

{noformat}
select * from jiraissue;
  id   | pkey | issuenum | project | reporter | assignee | creator | issuetype | summary | description | environment | priority | resolution
-------+------+----------+---------+----------+----------+---------+-----------+---------+-------------+-------------+----------+------------
 10000 |      |        1 |   10001 | admin    |          | admin   | 10005     | 1       |             |             | 3        |
 10002 |      |        2 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | 2       |             |             | 3        |
 10003 |      |        3 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | 3       |             |             | 3        |
 10001 |      |        2 |   10001 | admin    |          | admin   | 10005     | 1       |             |             | 3        |
(4 rows)
{noformat}

And after:

{noformat}
select * from jiraissue;
  id   | pkey | issuenum | project | reporter | assignee | creator | issuetype | summary | description | environment | priority | resolution
-------+------+----------+---------+----------+----------+---------+-----------+---------+-------------+-------------+----------+------------
 10000 |      |        1 |   10001 | admin    |          | admin   | 10005     | 1       |             |             | 3        |
 10002 |      |        2 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | 2       |             |             | 3        |
 10003 |      |        3 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | 3       |             |             | 3        |
 10001 |      |        2 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | test    |             |             | 3        |
(4 rows)
{noformat}

The {{moved_issue_key}} table is not updated:

{noformat}
select * from moved_issue_key ;
  id   | old_issue_key | issue_id
-------+---------------+----------
 10000 | MWK-1         |    10001
(1 row)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

The issue cannot be accessed to be moved, unless through bulk edit. Then when moving the issue back to TECH, it will create a new issue key (such as TECH-3). MWK-1 will then not redirect to TECH-3 and anything linked to TECH-2 will break. As such a SQL update is needed. For example:

# Stop JIRA.
# Identify the appropriate project:
{noformat}
select id from project where pkey = 'TECH';
  id
-------
 10001
(1 row)
{noformat}
# Update the issue to have the correct project:
{noformat}
update jiraissue set project = 10001 where id = 10001;
UPDATE 1
{noformat}
# Start JIRA and reindex.

This will allow updating with CSV, however any affected issue keys will need to be restored after the import. The alternative is to not map the issue key field however then new issues will be created instead of updating old ones.
fields.summary: CSV import with issue key overwrites existing issues , creates a duplicate issue and breaks the issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When setting JIRA up to run behind Apache HTTP server with SSL, as per our documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/integrating-jira-with-apache-using-ssl-203395380.html 
The redirection to the proxy FQDN does not work. 
Referring to step 7 of *Configure Tomcat*:
{quote}
Test that the new connector is working by accessing JIRA on the appropriate proxy connector, for example http://jiraserver:8080/. This should redirect to the proxy FQDN (in this example, https://jira.atlassian.com), which will fail as the proxy is not yet configured. The test is to ensure Tomcat is set up to correctly redirect to the proxy.
{quote}
In JIRA 7.1.0 and 7.1.1, accessing the non-proxy port directly does not trigger the redirect. You can access JIRA over localhost:8080/ 
This does not happen on JIRA 7.0.9 or 6.4.12.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1.0 or newer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.1.0, and configure its connector:
{code}
<Connector port="8082"

                   maxThreads="150"
                   minSpareThreads="25"
                   connectionTimeout="20000"

                   enableLookups="false"
                   maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"
                   protocol="HTTP/1.1"
                   useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
                   redirectPort="443"
                   acceptCount="100"
                   disableUploadTimeout="true"

                   proxyName="test.dleng.org"
                   proxyPort="443"
                   scheme="https"
                   secure="true"/>
{code}
# Set up Apache HTTP server:
{code}
<VirtualHost *:443>
        <Proxy *>
          Order deny,allow
          Allow from all
        </Proxy>
        SSLEngine               On
        SSLProxyEngine          On
        ProxyRequests           Off

        ServerName test.dleng.org

        ProxyPass               /       http://localhost:8082/
        ProxyPassReverse        /       http://localhost:8082/

        #   A self-signed (snakeoil) certificate can be created by installing
        #   the ssl-cert package. See
        #   /usr/share/doc/apache2.2-common/README.Debian.gz for more info.
        #   If both key and certificate are stored in the same file, only the
        #   SSLCertificateFile directive is needed.
        SSLCertificateFile /etc/apache2/extra/example.org/apache.crt
        SSLCertificateKeyFile /etc/apache2/extra/example.org/apache.key
</VirtualHost>
{code}
You can generate the self-signed certificate and key with: 
{code}
sudo openssl req -x509 -nodes -days 365 -newkey rsa:2048 -keyout example.org/apache.key -out example.org/apache.crt
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Accessing http://localhost:8082/ should redirect you to https://test.dleng.org/ 

h3. Actual Results
# While JIRA is *still starting up*, the redirect to proxy works just fine. Accessing via http://localhost:8082/ redirects to https://test.dleng.org/
# *After* JIRA starts up successfully, notice that the redirect doesn't work anymore. You can access JIRA via http://localhost:8082. 
Additionally behaviours include being unable to log-in if you access via localhost. 
# The following appears in the atlassian-jira.log:
{code}
2016-03-12 16:17:47,112 http-nio-8082-exec-15 WARN anonymous 977x33x1 - 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/webResources/1.0/resources [c.a.p.r.c.security.jersey.XsrfResourceFilter] Additional XSRF checks failed for request: https://test.dleng.org/rest/webResources/1.0/resources , origin: http://localhost:8082 , referrer: http://localhost:8082/secure/Dashboard.jspa , credentials in request: true , allowed via CORS: false
2016-03-12 16:17:47,160 http-nio-8082-exec-16 WARN anonymous 977x34x1 - 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/webResources/1.0/resources [c.a.p.r.c.security.jersey.XsrfResourceFilter] Additional XSRF checks failed for request: https://test.dleng.org/rest/webResources/1.0/resources , origin: http://localhost:8082 , referrer: http://localhost:8082/secure/Dashboard.jspa , credentials in request: true , allowed via CORS: false
{code}
# A warning message appears below the UI, with message:
{code}
We've detected a potential problem with JIRA's Dashboard configuration that your administrator can correct. Hide
Dashboard Diagnostics: Mismatched URL Scheme
{code}

h3. Additional notes
It didn't happen in 7.0.9, which uses the same Tomcat and Java version as 7.1.0.

h3. Resolution
Not a bug. It's a new behavior of JIRA 7.1. The root page no longer redirects.
fields.summary: Connector redirect to proxy FQDN doesn't work in JIRA 7.1+

h3. Summary

In FireFox 45 if an image is dragged off the screen from an issue then all links on the pages become unclickable. 

h3. How to Replicate

1) Create an issue
2) Attach an image to the issue
3) Click and Drag the image off issue page

h3. Expected Results
Page links should remain clickable after dragging an image off an issue.

h3. Actual Results
All links on page become unclickable

Occurs in FireFox version 45
Appears to be OS agnostic

Refreshing the page after dragging an image off the issue returns the links to a clickable state.

Summary When viewing certain content such as the average age gadget in the wallboard, you cannot tell what filter the graph belongs to as there is no title containing the filter name. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a dashboard # Add an average age gadget # View as wallboard h3. Expected Results The filter name should be included as a title, so that the chart is identifiable amongst other similar charts. h3. Actual Results There is no title provided for the gadget h3. The text gadget is disabled by default because it is a potential security risk, as it can contain arbitrary HTML which could potentially make your JIRA system vulnerable to XSS attacks. # From the apps administration page, enable the *Text* module under the *Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Gadgets Plugin* # Add the *Text* gadget next to each gadget in your dashboard # Add a title, and in the HTML field enter a gadget title, for example: {code}

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 29-Nov-2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}

Hello everyone! After analyzing this issue, these are our thoughts on it:
* This issue is specific to functions provided by the web browsers, not something in Jira itself. 
* This has only been reported for Jira 7.0.4 which reached [End of life|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-support-end-of-life-policy-201851003.html] some time ago.
* As of now, this behavior is no longer reproducible in the latest versions for the supported web browsers:
** Chrome 70: backspace is no longer linked to the  "back" browsing function.
** Firefox 63: you get a message indicating that you will lose the data: [^TestFirefox63.png]
** Internet Explorer:  [^IE11.png].
** MS Edge:  [^MSEdge.png]

This was tested in Jira 7.12.3

From these findings, we have decided to close this bug request. In case you have examples where you are experiencing this issue using supported Jira and web browser versions, please let us know!

Best regards,
René Chiquete - Atlassian Support.
{panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce with Chrome:

# Navigate around a bit so that you'r browser tab has some history
# Click the create issue link on top of the page
# Write something in description field
# Click the white space immediately to the left of the description field (so that the field loses focus)
# Hit backspace
# The browser should load the previous page you visited and you'll lose whatever you wrote in to the description field

h3, Actual Results

Browser navigates back and the dialog and its contents are lost.

h3. Expected Results

A confirmation message is displayed to prevent the user from losing the data in the form.

h3. Notes 
This does not work if the browser tab does not have any history to go back to

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Hitting backspace on the Create Issue dialog loses any form data

After upgrading from JIRA 6.7 to 7.1 we are missing translation on our gadgets view, but also for the version gadget.

Steps to reproduce: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60141?focusedCommentId=944702&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-944702
